wikipedia_page.main: Mary Davies (17 October 1846 – 8 October 1882), also known as Mair Eifion,  was a Welsh poet writing in the Welsh language.

response: *The ashes of the poet R. S. Thomas (1913–2000) are buried in the churchyard of St John's Church in Ffordd Penamser. An earlier poet raised in the town was Mary Davies (1846–1882), who wrote in Welsh.
Mary Davies was a Welsh singer.
Mary Davies may also refer to:
*Mary Davies Wilburn (1883–1987), longest-lived survivor of the sinking of the RMS Titanic
*Mary Davies (athlete), represented New Zealand at the 2009 World Championships in Athletics
*Mary Davies (heiress), wife of Sir Thomas Grosvenor, 3rd Baronet
